title: "We release a traditional skin when we change a champions look drastically"
body:
Sion changes skin color, completely changes his outfit, gets a hole in his chest, loses his hair, loses his skull face, gains a metal jaw, loses his ornate bone axe, loses his bone arm, gets stitches across his back: no traditional skin. 

Lee Sin changes his shorts and gets a haircut: Traditional Lee Sin. 

The bias is hilarious.

replies.body:
As much as I know he deserves one, Sion will *never* get a traditional skin for his original look.

Why? China. 

As racist as that sounds, it isn't. China, and alot of eastern asian cultures, find it offensive to display bones of the deceased in any form, and there are infact laws against it over there. 

League is trying to go international. As a result, they need a consistent character model across all regions. Hence why they will never have Sion getting a "traditional" skin.
Oh look, someone that's been paying attention, have an upvote.

Oops also forgot: COMPLETE PERSONALITY DELETION huehuehue. 
Sure his personality is changed. 

But even trundle didn't get THAT level of shift, at least he was still a "silly character". Sion is now Urgot 2.

Yeah, Sion used to be so different to Urgot, he used to be a reckless warrior that one day got himself into more trouble that he could handle and got himself killed, only to be brought back from the dead.

Whereas Urgot is a reckless warrior that one day got himself into more trouble that he could handle and got himself killed, only to be brought back from the dead as a robotic crab man.

um, Bullsh!t?

Now he is a brute that screws over his race to "save" them and also rule as their king, and is no longer wolverine. Complete character deletion.

Sion looks like he is getting more grimdark, but honestly I think that could have hid behind the Ahnuld voice over terribad model, as while he may have looked goofy, his lore was anything but.
another person that does not know the old lore and yet talks.

>Prior to the creation of the League of Legends, the city-states of Demacia and Noxus were locked in a brutal series of on-again-off-again wars that spanned the course of centuries. Both powers sought an advantage over the other, but Noxus was the city-state willing to forego conventional morality to achieve its goals. Only brute strength and the will to use it mattered to Noxus, and this is best exemplified in the murderous warrior, Sion. Used by the Noxians as a human battering ram, Sion would be sent thundering ahead of Noxian troops. He would mercilessly slaughter foes with his large double-bladed axe, "Chopper". His complete disregard for caution ultimately cost him his life, as he was captured and summarily executed by Demacian forces.

>The Demacians thought that the beheading of Sion would be the end of his bloodthirsty ways. Death, however, was merely the beginning of Sion's rise to power. The famed Noxian assassin, {{champion:55}}  Katarina, recovered Sion's remains and Noxian necromancers reanimated the behemoth to serve Noxus once again. Sion's reanimation actually bestowed new powers on him and increased the potency of his existing abilities, making him even more of a terror to behold on the battlefield. The Noxian High Command had a powerful new weapon in their hands - one they have brought to bear as a champion in the League of Legends. Even though Sion's increased powers would make him a powerful tool for the High Command's use outside the Fields of Justice, Noxus no longer risks losing one of their greatest champions in the League to chance or circumstance; Sion's days as a front-line fighter for Noxus' military conquests are at an end. 

Here is the old lore. Re-read it.

Yes, the quality of writing is bad, but at the same time, most of the new story doesn't contradict the old. With notable exceptions being that the league no longer exists, and instead of being captured he gave his life to take a king's. A bit more heroic, but at the same time not that different. If you translate "Noxian Necromancers" to be the Black rose, then even that adds up, even if the old lore skimped on details.

It's basically the same character, but better written.

I'm wondering about this as well. They gave Sej a traditional skin when they simply changed what she wore. So it would be VERY weird not to give Sion a traditional skin when they change him completely. I am concerned it isn't happening though since it isn't on the PBE or on the reveal page.

Would really love if some Rioter could just answer whether he is getting one or not.

Traditional Lee Sin was never given out. The traditional line concept came out after the skin was named and put into the store. 

The only Traditional Skins that were given out are for Karma, Trundle, and Sej. These skins are also locked up while Lee's is not.

You got to love when people make threads and know nothing about what they are posting. For the love of god please try to do some research. I am not even going to bother with the rest of your ideas. 

 DOWN VOTES INCOMING FOR THE TRUTH.

Maybe you should.  It's his goddamn traditional skin.  Let's run down all of the traditional skins in the game?  Trundle?  New textures.  Karma?  Nothing.  Sejuani?  Nothing.  Lee Sin?  Nothing.  Sion?  Probably textures at most, but most likely... NOTHING.  It literally will just be a recolor of his current skin with a bony arm, and his AHNOLD voicelines.  To quote Dr. House,

>  Somewhere out there there is a tree, tirelessly producing oxygen so you can breathe. I think you owe it an apology.
Traditional Sion would proooobably just use default particles, because, you know. Entirely new move set except for the shield which is the same but visually improved.

My guess is it isn't done yet or it's in the works.

Also, Traditional Lee is a terrible example because A.) it was his original, ORIGINAL look and B.) it was before traditional skins were a thing.
Riot really?  No traditional Sion?  You mean I'm not going to be able to play as the Govenator?  I'm disappointed.

My guess is that Sion's old model is so gnarled that to do a traditional skin they'd have to invent a Tradional Sion.

Leaving out all irrelevant animations, creating a highly complicated model (all those changes you mentioned would have to be plowed over, it's essentially starting from scratch), and losing a lot of quotes (no grunts or anything, would sound awkwardly silent), you get left with a really crappy skin that had a whole ton of effort put into it.

It's not bias, it's way easier to redo textures and add a few animations for a skin, then to redo an entire model (which is way more complex then the updated base), dealing with a new VO, and an entirely new set of animations for said specific model.

The is most likely because of what they said a very long time ago, and why they have almost zero skeletal champions in game. China, on of leagues biggest usebase, is very superstitious when it comes to skeletons and undead. Sion has always been barely able to skate by for that reason. So when they remade him they did away with all the skeletal parts because of that exact superstitious belief. 

Although, I totally agree most of my favorite parts of sion was his goofy zombie/skeleton look AND DAT ARNOLD voice. Please riot keep the hilarious arnold puns, stop being so god damn worried about copy right problems. Seriously if anythigng bugs me about LoL its that they are deathly afraid to make ANY reference to pop culture stuff besides dances in their game.
Sion didn't dramatically change. The resemblance is still obvious. As for Lee Sin, that has another story of its own.

He won't get a traditional skin since China doesn't approve of bones in video games out of respect for the deceased.

This game is owned by Tencent.  They will not create ANYTHING that Tencent doesn't approve of.

As a game that they want to be played internationally, they respect when a large percentage of customers are against a product.
